articles.title: Committees for remembering Kim Il Sung formed
Epic in praise of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Committees for remembering Kim Il Sung formed
       Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Committees for remembering the President Kim Il Sung were inaugurated in Cambodia and Germany.   Norodom Ranariddh, chairman of the National United Front of an Independent, Neutral, Peaceful and Cooperative Cambodia (Funcinpec) and president of the National Assembly, was elected chairman of the committee in Cambodia, and the chairman of the central committee of the Communist Party of Germany was elected chairman of the committee in Germany.   The committees decided to propagandize the greatness of President Kim Il Sung and to hold various functions in this period.

articles.content:
Cold weather in east coastal area of Korea
      Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Unusual drought and heat are continuing in the west coastal area and the northern inland of Korea.
   On the contrary, in the east coastal area of Korea it is cloudy and temperature is sharply dropping from June 28.
   The temperature was  22.9 degrees centigrade in Wonsan, 22.4 in Hamhung and 19.6 in Chongjin on July 1.
   It stood at 20.6 degrees centigrade in Wonsan and 23.3 in Hamhung on July 2 or 0.9-3.4 degrees lower than the average temperature. The temperature in Chongjin on July 3 was 0.6 degrees lower than that of July 1.
   The growth of crops is seriously affected by cloudy weather and drizzle caused by a long spell of low temperature.
   Drought and heat are expected to last until July 6 in the west coastal area  and northern inland while cold weather is anticipated to continue in the east coastal area.

articles.content:
Korean Buddhist masses held for reunification
       Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Buddhist masses for national reunification were held at temples across the DPRK Sunday 27 years after the July 4 joint statement was announced.
   Speeches were made at the end of rites for national reunification at the masses.
   Speakers renewed their firm determination to give momentum to the reunification movement, closely uniting with the entire fellow countrymen in the north, south and abroad under the banner of great national unity.
   They condemned the u.s. Imperialists and their followers, separatist war hawks for having worked out an anti-north war scenario "operation plan 5027-98" and committed reckless military provocations in the west sea of Korea and around the Korean peninsula, and called upon Buddhists at home and abroad to conduct vigorous activities to check such moves.

articles.content:
U.S. movies rejected in S. Korea
      Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- The Citizen's Federation for Democratic Society and 34 other civic organizations of South Korea on July 1  rejected U.S. movies and held demonstrations in front of Seoul Theatre and 3 other theatres before burning U.S.-made goods in effigy, according to a Seoul-based radio report.   These organizations in a statement accused the U.S. of forcing those regions in the grip of foreign exchange crisis to import its cultural industrial products under the cloak of "investment."

articles.title: Greetings to Venezuelan President
articles.content:
Many triplets born
      Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- About a hundred groups of triplets were born in Korea in the recent five years.
   17  groups of triplets were born from July, Juche 83 (1994),  to the end of the year. The past five years witnessed the birth of more triplets than those in the corresponding period of the preceding years.
   The President Kim Il Sung  showed deep care and warm love for them in his lifetime, saying births of many triplets  were the sign of the country's prosperity.
   General Secretary Kim Jong Il, who inherited his noble love, has sent them gifts of love to be handed down  through generations in the five years though the country  has suffered from difficulties and ordeals.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Il from diplomatic corps
articles.content:
Greetings to Venezuelan President
   Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, today sent a message of greetings to Hugo Chavez Frias, President of Venezuela, on the occasion of its Independence Day.
   The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop on good terms and wished the president and people of Venezuela new success in their work for the prosperity of the country.
